titleStmt.title: Letter, Joseph Oliver Freeman in Tipton County, Tennessee, to his sister, 1863 September 16

publicationStmt.publisher: The University of Tennessee Libraries Digital Initiatives

availability.p: The copyright interests in this collection remain with the creator. For more information, contact the Special Collections Library.

bibl.title: Letter, Joseph Oliver Freeman in Tipton County, Tennessee, to his sister, 1863 September 16
bibl.note: Joseph Oliver Freeman Letters, 1861 December 22 - 1864 June 12, undated

projectDesc.p: Machine-readable transcription created for The University of Tennessee Libraries Special Collections.

editorialDecl.p: Corrections have been applied to the text only where there is a high degree of certainty of an error and if the correct spelling is known.
Corrections are represented by editorial tags.
Quotation marks and apostrophes have been replaced by entity references.
All unambiguous end-of-line hyphens have been removed.
Names of persons, places, and organizations are indicated in the transcription when identifiable with a high degree of certainty.

revisionDesc.change: Updated earlier transcription from the old TEI.2 system to anticipate and resolve difficulties and issues with re-formatting letters from this collection into TEI-P5 lite.

Added "idno" element, editorial declaration statement, subjects/keywords and abstracts from EAD finding aid. Removed box and folder notes, reference declaration element. Changed the formatting for blank pages. Added resp attributes to editorial changes, and added name tags.

opener.dateline: State of tipton county tenn Sept th 16th

div.p: I resieve your kind letter this evening whitch I was very glad to see it found us all up but Mr Stokes he has bin rite Sick every Since last Sunday he has had the doctor with him but he is better to nite the fever is broke but he is not able to Set up yet but I hope he Will be in a day or So

Inda you ought to ove bin her last wendesday and Saw Wat a time we had there was to be a triel here between ed angers and kid well and thay got mad and kid well presented his gun to Shoot angers and Marion Chatnon tooke the gun from him and then angers took out his pistol and it fired ouf before he got redy and it went throu

the tope of the house and then he Shot at kid well but mist him and the bali went in the wall rite by the water bucket if ever you ever Saw a Scird Set it was her Mrs burton was her as wel and She had not ovit when Started home at nite henry wants to see Jose very bad last nite he waked up and called his par and Says poor J gone I cant See her no more he Says Jo lives at Mr tabers well I well have to close for the want of paper
rite Soon looke over bad Spelling and riting Termeliu Stokes to I freeman
